Quick Start Guide¶

Requirements¶

Django Mail Queue requires:

south
django 1.4 or greater
celery
django-celery

Installation¶

Using pip:

pip install django-mail-queue

Go to https://github.com/kstateome/django-mail-queue if you need to download a package or clone the repo.

Setup¶

Open settings.py and add api_docs to your INSTALLED_APPS:

INSTALLED_APPS = (
    'mailqueue',
    'south',
)

Add URL-patterns:

urlpatterns = patterns('',
    (r'^mail-queue/', include('mailqueue.urls')),
)

Cron Job (optional)¶

Setup a cron job to hit the root of mail-queue. So the example above would hit /mail-queue. This runs the mail queue which grabs emails and sends them. To decrease load, it only tries to send 30 emails at a time.

Celery¶

Celery is disabled by default(in 1.2.1), you can turn it on the use of Celery and send emails in real time using MAILQUEUE_CELERY in settings:

MAILQUEUE_CELERY = True

Instead of using the cron job the celery task worker will attempt to send email email when it’s saved. The cron job will clean up any emails that get lost.
